name: Oplan Tokhang
description:
President Rodrigo Roa Duterte Regime

Duterte was sworn in as president on June 30, 2016.

“Oplan Tokhang,” a program that saw cops go to the homes of suspected drug criminals, mostly without a warrant, to allegedly invite them to the barangay hall or the police station for questioning.

Reports that came out later that year said, based on eyewitness testimonies and evidence, that police were summarily gunning down suspected drug criminals when they conducted their anti-drug operations.

1,916 Filipinos died in less than three months—an average of 60 people every day since Duterte became president.

Source: https://stopthekillings.ph/?page_id=1330
For additional information about the drug war on the Philippines visit https://stopthekillings.ph/
